intro: Xanthomyrtus aurea, commonly known as the golden myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the rainforests of eastern Australia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. Xanthomyrtus aurea is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for horticultural use in gardens and landscapes.
